v.v: Yahweh continued to speak to Job; he said,
“Should anyone who wishes to criticize try to correct the Almighty?

v: He who argues with God, let him answer.”

v.v: Then Job answered Yahweh and said,
“See, I am insignificant; how can I answer you?
I spoke once, and I will not answer;

v: I put my hand over my mouth.
indeed, twice, but I will proceed no further.”

v.v: Then Yahweh answered Job out of a fierce storm and said,
“Now gird up your loins like a man,
Will you actually say that I am unjust?
Do you have an arm like God’s?
Now clothe yourself in glory and dignity;
Scatter around the excess of your anger;
Look at everyone who is proud and bring him low;
Bury them in the earth together;
Then will I also acknowledge about you
Look now at the behemoth, which I made when I made you;
See now, his strength is in his loins;
He makes his tail like a cedar;
His bones are like tubes of bronze;
He is the chief of the creatures of God.
For the hills provide him with food;
He lies under the lotus plants
The lotus plants cover him with their shade;
See, if a river floods its banks, he does not tremble;
Can anyone capture him with a hook,

v: for I will ask you questions, and you must answer me.
Will you condemn me so you may claim you are right?
Can you thunder with a voice like him?
array yourself in honor and majesty.
look at everyone who is proud and bring him down.
trample down wicked people where they stand.
imprison their faces in the hidden place.
that your own right hand can save you.
he eats grass like an ox.
his power is in his belly’s muscles.
the sinews of his thighs are joined together.
his legs are like bars of iron.
Only God, who made him, can defeat him.
the beasts of the field play nearby.
in the shelter of the reeds, in the marshes.
the willows of the brook are all around him.
he is confident, though the Jordan should surge up to his mouth.
or pierce his nose through with a snare?
